meanings.definition: Very poor or bad in quality
meanings.sent1: The movie we watched last night was lousy; it was not good at all.
meanings.sent2: The food at that restaurant is usually lousy; I wouldn't recommend it.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fix my old, lousy phone with tape, but it just made it worse!
meanings.sent4: The lousy weather ruined our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The lousy service at the store made me never want to go back there again.

meanings.sent1: The stray cat looked lousy, and we suspected it might have lice.
meanings.sent2: After camping in the woods, my friend's hair became lousy from the insects.
meanings.sent3: The lousy dog scratched itself constantly, making us think it had lice.
meanings.sent4: The lousy mattress was infested with lice, causing discomfort for the guests.
meanings.sent5: The lousy pillow was thrown away after it was discovered to be lice-infested.

meanings.sent1: I woke up feeling lousy and decided to stay home from work.
meanings.sent2: She felt lousy after eating too much candy at the party.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling lousy, he managed to finish his homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The lousy flu season made many people feel unwell.
meanings.sent5: The lousy stomach ache kept her up all night in discomfort.
